span.br:
SIGN UP FOR A CURBSIDE MEAL HERE if you are a parent or guardian who will pick up a curbside meal without a child present.
The child must be present to receive meals OR the parent or legal guardian may pick up meals without the child present, only if they sign up online at least by the day before pickup. Those who sign up must pick up meals at Mexico Middle and Mexico High as your reservation will be scheduled at these locations; you will give your name at the curbside pick up. Families will only need to sign up once, and you will stay on the list until you let us know otherwise.

To follow the order of Governor Parson extended on April 9, the Mexico School District 59 is closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. At-home learning opportunities and meal service will continue. MSHSAA has cancelled spring sports.
At this time, there are no finalized plans in place for prom or graduation. We must follow all directives, including social distancing guidelines and stay-at-home orders from our local, state, and federal government officials. We will reach out to you as we work on a plan in the coming days. Please continue to check your Mexico 59 communication channels for further updates and announcements.

br.span:
Welcome to Mexico School District 59. We are located in Mexico, Missouri. We currently educate over 2,500 students in all of our locations. We have an early childhood center, three elementary schools, a middle school, high school, alternative school, and career center. The summer and fall of 2017 construction was completed at each of our school buildings. Our Superintendent is Dr. Zachary Templeton and our Assistant Superintendent is Dr. Larry Nelson.
The mission of the Mexico Public Schools is to foster in each student:
--a positive self-image,
--critical and creative thinking skills,
--responsible citizenship, a dedicated work ethic, and
--adaptability in a changing technological society
Each student will have at his or her command a specific grade level body of knowledge.

p.span: Mexico School District 59 is committed to ensuring accessibility of its websites for students, parents, and members of the community with disabilities. All pages on the District’s and school websites are intended to conform with the W3C Web Accessibility Initiative’s (WAI) Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0. If you have questions or concerns regarding our website, please submit information here.
